website_summaries.verdict: A beachfront favorite that's comfortable on the arms, even without a break-in period.
pros: 18 hand-sewn panels creates deep grooves for better hand control and wind resistance
Quality construction for durability and shape retention
Microfiber composite leather provides dirt resistance
cons: Some lose air, so be sure to bring your pump

customer_reviews.title: The balls made in China are great, the ones made in Vietnam are slightly shiny ...
customer_reviews.text: The balls made in China are great, the ones made in Vietnam are slightly shiny and the seams aren't smooth. You don't know what you're getting until you get them. I ordered two from the same seller and got one made in China and one made in Vietnam, twice. I had to return the Vietnam balls each time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the Chinese version or chose a different seller
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I received the volleyball made in Vietnam which has a glossy texture, almost feels plastic, which makes it very slippery and harder to hand set. It sucks because none of my friends (who have the Chinese version) wants to play with it. I don't blame them, so the ball just sits in my bag. Worst $45 I ever spent. To anyone who reads this, please make sure you get the Chinese version or chose a different seller. You'll thank me.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: I received 6 China made volleyballs!!! (NOT VIETNAM)
customer_reviews.text: YES!! Vietnam made balls are the worst. I have one that only lasted a few weeks before loosing its shape and now is just laying around in the garage. However I recently just bought 6 of these balls from amazon only hoping that they would be made in China. They arrived a couple of days ago and to my surprise they are from China yay!!! and also fully inflated. Thank you Amazon!! Excellent balls and good quality. I guess Wilson finally decided to pull the plug on Vietnam made balls.
customer_reviews.author: Penetrator

customer_reviews.title: Best Outdoor Ball that I have tried.
customer_reviews.text: I like this volleyball better than the Molten and Spalding King Of The Beach. The Molten seems to be affected by the wind more. The Spalding is great in the wind but has a harder impact. Best outdoor ball I have owned. The only con I have found and I believethis would be the same for most outdoor balls. It does not repel water well and playing the rain it does get heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: knock-off
customer_reviews.text: this was made cheaply and felt like plastic. not the same product my fellow volleyball players use on the beach for practice. I thought I was getting a good deal but it ended up wasting my time. returned. bought a quality mikasa beach champ for a good chunk more. i was disappointed in the seller. these are normally great quality if you buy them from a reputable sports store for $55. this is a replica, not the real thing. replicas should be $19. i think they say the good ones are made it thailand. this was not a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Lemon Twist

customer_reviews.title: Bar volleyball league
customer_reviews.text: After playing too many seasons of bar league volleyball with flat ripped balls I finally purchased my own to bring. I love this ball. Enough of us started buying and bringing our own that the bar took notice and they purchased this same ball to replace all their others. Be forewarned that this ball will need breaking in. Many people complained that this ball was too hard to play with during the first couple of months. With enough play and a few rounds in the dryer on low the ball is softer and no more complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Kathrine K.

customer_reviews.title: Soft touch, great for beginner in addition to the intended use as a beach/sand ball
customer_reviews.text: Got this one for my daughter who was just starting to learn hard-court volleyball. The one I had before was hurting her badly. This one is soft to touch but not too soft, good enough to help her arms adjust better. So far fairly decent durability as we use this for practice outdoor on asphalt. The other ball I had showed obvious nicks and cuts after a few practices but this ball seemed to hold much better. She now carries this ball everywhere around the house and are spending a lot of time outside practicing. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Hoei L

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best
customer_reviews.text: I am not a huge fan of Wilson indoor volleyballs for numerous reasons, so I never guessed in a million years that Wilson’s beach volleyball would be worth a crap. I was wrong. From serving to passing to setting to attacking, this ball is amazing. It’s like all the problems outdoor balls face (sand, water weighing it down, etc.) fade away, and you can just focus on what maters: playing volleyball. PS—The way the inflation valve is hidden and almost impossible to detect by the eyes AND hands is genius. What can’t every volleyball use this technology?
customer_reviews.author: Allen Loibner-Waitkus

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the original or the KOB
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing with AVP volleyballs for over 10 years and own 3 different variations, the OPTX ball is smaller and less durable. Its barely lasted this summer season and I only play twice a week. All the graphics are wearing off. Additionally, the yellow ball is much harder to see during our night games--we usually switch the the blue/white Molten or a King of the Beach ball if either are available. I'm not impressed, especially at $65!
customer_reviews.author: TQ

customer_reviews.title: Warped Volleyball 😡😡😡
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ball as a gift to give and unfortunately when it was unboxed by the person receiving the gift, we found a warped ball to our disappointment. I have noticed this with other volleyball players buying these new wilson balls. Beware and inspecting these balls well!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: The only way to spike
customer_reviews.text: What’s to say ... this is one of the few balls to pick from if you’re looking for a great sand volleyball. I chose this ball because it’s what we generally use when we play. The ball serves well, doesn’t kill the arms/fingers on bumps, sets, blocks, digs, etc. I’ve seen some reviews about counterfeit balls and I seem not to have gotten one.
customer_reviews.author: Al G

customer_reviews.title: Thread is already coming off
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Customer Service and warranty makes up for a defective product! This is a great ball, it floats better and grips easier to handset. I probably just received a defective product, bur customer service/warranty on the product makes up for it. Already starts breaking apart only after using for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: J. Philly

customer_reviews.title: High price but worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is as good as it gets for beach volleyballs. Of course, the downside is the high price. But you get what you pay for. This is a high quality ball that will give you years of playing. I recommend this ball for beginners all the way through pros. Don’t waste your time with lower quality balls because they will hurt your arms and hands.
customer_reviews.author: Chinorican

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: Ball came slightly overinflated, but it is much better than the balls that ship flat with creases. I have always been concerned the creases cause damage to the ball. I have only used it a couple times so far, but I really enjoy the texture and durable feel of the ball. It feels slightly heavier than the KOBs, and a little thicker than my previous Wilson AVP.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Nice but expense, hoping it lasts
customer_reviews.text: The ball arrived overinflated which caused it to be lopsided. Immediately I wanted to return the ball. I took out some air then squeezed the ball. After some work it became ok enough not to hassle with a return. After a week play I already have a few good scratches. It does not seem as durable as my old avp ball.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Well “ rounded “ ball. Great mix of many style volleyball balls
customer_reviews.text: I really like this new ball. Much better than the previous AVP Wilson. Great feel for hand setting.. better bite when jump serving. Not as pingy when passing.. I got three and the first time I used them one of them went flat.. I’m guessing from a pricker bush :( So just bad luck I’d guess .. or thin wall bladder?
customer_reviews.author: K. Smallwood

customer_reviews.title: Very durable. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice ball. Got the China made. we play every weekend. Enjoy it. 6th Oct 2018. - Have to take back my comments. I saw today the volleyball was deflated :( Looks like its bust now. We only play on grass in the park. To know it only came for less than 2 months is disappointing. I dont know how to contact the seller. Hope they can see this and respond :(
customer_reviews.author: familyguy

customer_reviews.title: that doesn't have the black gradients are way better than this ball
customer_reviews.text: So I am not sure how this is an upgrade at all. The previous balls, the Made in China and the Vietnam, that doesn't have the black gradients are way better than this ball. The older ones feel quality, like real grippy and even the printed color parts are not platicy feeling. I'd be curious to know what if any the "upgrades" where except maybe cheaper manufacturing and more profit for them. BUT, because they are the official ball of AVP, we all must adapt.
customer_reviews.author: David Evans

customer_reviews.title: This is a good beach volleyball once you get used to it.
customer_reviews.text: It is the standard on the beaches this year. It is smaller than the Spalding King of the Beach and not as soft. Once you are used to it, it offers a dependable ball for passing. It is easy to set with hand or bump. It is better in the wind than the Spalding or the old AVP balls.
customer_reviews.author: W from Chicago Metro

customer_reviews.title: The ball made in China is clearly made WAY BETTER! We are very happy with the purchase and ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the AVP II ball last week from Amazon. The ball arrived a little deflated (which we thought was intentional), but apparently it had a defect because we played that night and the next morning it was flat again. This ball was one of the ones made in Vietnam (which I had read previous reviews that had similar problems). We sent it back to Amazon and they sent us another ball the next day. This ball came inflated and was one made in China. The ball made in China is clearly made WAY BETTER! We are very happy with the purchase and love the ball. Would highly recommend-just make sure you get one that is made in China!
customer_reviews.author: Viktor

customer_reviews.title: Love the ball but broke after 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ball a acouple of months ago. I initially LOVED the feel and quality, but after playing beach volleyball with it about 10 times over 6 weeks, I noticed the ball started deflating. Since it no longer held air, I assumed it had somehow gotten a cut on it. I put it under water to determine if there's a leak that I could possibly repair, but it immediately started bubbling from almost every seam. Clearly, there was no repairing it. Very disappointing, loved the ball but I didn't get to enjoy it enough. I'm assuming I just got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: Valentina_1970

customer_reviews.title: As was new I decided to give a chance and see if by using it a couple of times become like any other original Wilson AVP but it didnt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ball and from the begining I noticed that this ball is different than the original once in color and texture. As was new I decided to give a chance and see if by using it a couple of times become like any other original Wilson AVP but it didnt. What is even worst is that after using this ball ten times know the ball is flat, not sure where is the leak, but lost all the air 24 hours after inflating it. I would put zero if I could.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite ball
customer_reviews.text: Really nice ball that flies straight in windy conditions and doesn't destroy your arms when bumping. The ball has a great feel and has held up well to the heat of Arizona. I prefer this ball over the King of the Beach which I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Decent ball
customer_reviews.text: Wish I went with the black and white Spalding. Not a bad little ball but for the price.....ehhh. Super soft outdoor ball. Mine doesn’t really seem to hold air for more than a week without having to retouch it
customer_reviews.author: Tiana B

customer_reviews.title: Bad plastic vietnam ball with no stem for blowing up the ball. Will be requesting a refund!
customer_reviews.text: Got the Crappy plastic vietnam ball with no stem for blowing up the ball. Came flat and with a hole where the blow up mechanism should be, seems like a replica ball? Will be returning!! Not too sure why I got the crappy ball and not the official AVP ball that is listed here, will be requesting a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Ford

customer_reviews.title: Got the new AVP ball for my bday as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: The ball is fine. to me, it's not any different than the previous ball (other than appearance). but, the price ($65) is crazy high. It should be no more than $40. But, being the official game ball of the AVP, they can pretty much charge whatever they want. I would recommend buying the previous generation AVP ball just cuz it's less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B. Skramstad

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on the best ball
customer_reviews.text: The best ball period. When these went on sale I knew I had to act fast and grab one. The price was even less than what Costco charges. Wish I had ordered more for friends. Can’t wait to get back on the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Chemical Mike

customer_reviews.title: Reeeeally good ball, but...
customer_reviews.text: We all know why it's so darn expensive. It's new. Everyone has one and they know people are willing to pay the extra cheddar cheese rather than show up tp games with the older one, which, to my understanding is still the same price. This ball should not cost as much as your cable bill.
customer_reviews.author: y2jason23

customer_reviews.title: New favorite
customer_reviews.text: Obsessed with this ball. Came pumped up, no issues with delivery. The design and colors really helps with recognizing any spin. The leather is soft and doesn’t sun rot at easily as the older AVP balls.
customer_reviews.author: Kuulei Lasike

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical of the new design, but it is the best VB out there right now
customer_reviews.text: First time I saw it, I wondered why those guys were playing with a soccer ball. Once we played with it though, it was better than the prev one. Better than the Wilson KOB ball too.
customer_reviews.author: McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and quality volleyball.
customer_reviews.text: I like to play pickup games here and there and occasionally with local recreation events where I saw them using the same ball. It's versatile for anyone wanting to play for fun and durable enough for more competitive play as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sinbin

customer_reviews.title: Best Beach Ball...for hand sets
customer_reviews.text: For outdoor play, this is the best ball, especially for hand setters. Much easier to have clean hand sets with these, verses the KOB Volleyball's. I also like that these are slightly smaller in diameter, compared to the original avp's. I haven't used the new ones enough to tell the durability, but first impressions are that it is well made, and should last a few seasons of consistent pick-up play.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Courville

customer_reviews.title: Good beach ball
customer_reviews.text: The extra paint on the ball makes it slightly more slippery. But, I haven't been effected by it. The colors do stand out better on the court.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball!
customer_reviews.text: This ball is awesome! It is extremely soft and has great balance to it. This is the best volleyball i have aver used! I have been playing for the past 5 years and this has been the best ball i have used! It also looks great too! Definitely a great choice for someone looking for a pro ball!
customer_reviews.author: Amelia 181

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be broken in!
customer_reviews.text: We will have to see when I break this ball in. I have owned 100's of volleyballs. Its slippery for the expensive game ball out of the box. Im sure once it breaks in it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: amy moravick

customer_reviews.title: Great ball
customer_reviews.text: Huge difference between this and cheaper vballs. I can't speak to durability as of yet, but my team plays with this ball versus the athletic center balls. Enough said!
customer_reviews.author: Eros Dialogos

customer_reviews.title: hard to find
customer_reviews.text: hard to find this version of the official Wilson beach volleyball. they have shifted to the ugly black and yellow version
customer_reviews.author: SFE7

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The Wilson AVP beach volleyball is the perfect ball for the beach. The ball came in a slightly damaged box but the ball was in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Came in an oversized box, wrapping paper, and original package. I think packaging is important and the feel of this ball is exactly what we wanted. After playing, my daughter said this is her favorite volleyball out of 7 she already has. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Willis

customer_reviews.title: Rewards skill more than the prior ball. I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This ball is so much better than the prior ball. This ball is more responsive to spin, so you can shape serves and hits more easily. It also doesn't float up nearly as readily as the prior ball. Both of these things are good in that you can work to have a better serve and you have to earn a good serve. (That prior ball felt like the best move was just to serve a floater and hope it didn't something wild.)
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: The older AVP balls were better
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered (made in China) would not hold air. A few hours after inflating it would go flat. The replacement ball (made in Vietnam) has a glossy finish. I washed it with dish soap but it still has a bit of a replica feel. The one from China had a better, leather like feel.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Best volleyball ever
customer_reviews.text: It is the perfect weight and size. even if you are not professional it is worth to invest in it. It also won't hurt your hand too much and does not slip.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor sand volleyball
customer_reviews.text: Great feeling ball. The AVP tour was selling them for 30 bucks more, so I just picked one up from here. Maybe I can get them at Whole Foods now too?? It's been a few months and it seems to be holding air pressure pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Bret VA

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the AVP I (original)
customer_reviews.text: The "leather" feel is much different than the original AVP 1 volleyball. So, I returned this version 2 and bought the version 1.
customer_reviews.author: stan94520

customer_reviews.title: I'm a pro
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 11/29/19 got the Chinese version, Viet version looks terrible and should be easily distinguishable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Var

customer_reviews.title: Light, waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Light and perfect for my outdoor needs. I use this to play with my friends every weekend on grass. Sometimes it rains and we play in the rain. In spite of getting wet, the VB doesn’t retain any water which is the best part
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Khatkhate

customer_reviews.title: Great volleyball, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality. We have used many times and it is a good quality ball. Highly recommended. We used to have a cheaper beach volleyball and it used to hurt our arms. This one does not do this at all and we have played many times and for many hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: evelyn dieppa

customer_reviews.title: Great ball, stable to bump and hit
customer_reviews.text: Great ball, stable to bump and hit, nice feel of the weight and doesn't hurt the arm. It's 3 times better than the $20 balls and thus better value.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaRaptor

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: It always happens when you buy a new ball and a new design comes out...
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Nice new ball!
customer_reviews.text: Loving the new Wilson ball. Looks and feels good, and it comes inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Juanes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ball
customer_reviews.text: I play volleyball multiple times per week and this is the best ball I've had/hit. It feels like durability is going to be strong moving forward as well, but that is yet to be tested.
customer_reviews.author: htm

customer_reviews.title: 1st ball was not useful, but 2nd is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Product was late, Ball was not round and something was sticking out of the seam. Seller allowed me to return item with no return shipping cost. Second ball was great. I gave 4 stars because of the late shipping, it am now completely happy with the volley ball I have.
customer_reviews.author: Prime time

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for group sand volleyball. It holds up well to the abuse and retains its durability. It has been several weeks and it is still good.
customer_reviews.author: Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Best AVP balls yet!
customer_reviews.text: easier to track. especially at night and in low-light conditions. best beach volleyball yet! nice job Wilson!
customer_reviews.author: IT Geek

customer_reviews.title: Bump it.
customer_reviews.text: This ball is the real deal. This is one ball you'll be happy to hit.
customer_reviews.author: BPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Pricy Ball - But official Beach Volleyball
customer_reviews.text: This was a pricy Beach Volleyball but you pay for what you get. Compared to the other one that we have this fit right for the beach and the colors/patterns help with reading the spins on the ball. It also helps being flashy and official. Now its how to get good at Beach Volleyball...
customer_reviews.author: Rosanna L Hui

customer_reviews.title: Marines in Kuwait Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: Sent this ball off to a Gunnery Sergeant in Kuwait. The Marines play a lot of volley ball there. This was just what they needed.
customer_reviews.author: Luvbead

customer_reviews.title: simply the best
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the BEST beach volleyball for serious game play. Right weight, feel, durability... For those reading this, do NOT buy anything with the word "replica"! Not the same thing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Bump, Set, Spike
customer_reviews.text: There's not any sand volleyballs that take your game to the next level, and this one will certainly not make you a better player. But it is a solid ball that any average or above average player will respect as you are pounding thunderous spikes on their side of the net.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Wrong ball sent
customer_reviews.text: I originally order the Wilson ball and what came was a bright neon Wilson ball instead of the yellow that's from the picture of description. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Trung

customer_reviews.title: Just great
customer_reviews.text: Great touch. Used for youth sand club practices and tournaments.
customer_reviews.author: Thierry T

customer_reviews.title: Great ball. Wish the price would come down a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great ball. Wish the price would come down a bit like the old version which feels and plays the same. I feel like I'm paying more for design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally not a fake ball
customer_reviews.text: First Wilson ball I've bought (I've always purchased Spaulding KOB balls). I like this one way more than the previous yellow and white Wilson's. Seems to be fine with water. Scuffs up pretty easily though. Good for playing at dusk.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: This is the ball you want to play with
customer_reviews.text: The material is great. I could not find the same at any stores and I am so happy with this purchase. Totally different feeling from the replica ones that u find at regular athletic stores
customer_reviews.author: naghmeh kamalan

customer_reviews.title: Beware of different manufacturers!!!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently there are now two manufacturers of this ball and the quality is very different... I received the poorer quality ball. It has a plastic like sheen to it..you can tell right away.. I guess this is the risk of buying it on line...
customer_reviews.author: Kjell Nilssen

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Feels like the last generation but is easier to see especially when it's overcast.
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: Made in China which is finally a good thing this time.
customer_reviews.text: Favorite beach ball. Make sure you get the one made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Burnthenetter

customer_reviews.title: Good quality volleyball
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality volleyball. I've been using it quite a bit and love the feel of it and it seems to be pretty durable and made from quality material. The feel of it is great and I'm sure it will hold up well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Got the Made in china ball!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was afraid I wouldn't get the ball that was made in China. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: P. denDulk

customer_reviews.title: Made in China!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the other reviews, I was worried about not receiving the one made in China. Thank g o d we did. Works well!
customer_reviews.author: Baymate

customer_reviews.title: I got a defected ball. The listing says made ...
customer_reviews.text: I got a defected ball. The listing says made in China but it was made in Vietnam which has been identified as making these ball shinier and the panels are off.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Doeringer

customer_reviews.title: Stitch came out after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Wilson AVP ball after owning many Spalding KOB balls. After a month of playing with the ball a Stitch came out causing the ball to become lopsided and unplayable in games. I expect better construction and duriblty
customer_reviews.author: luke kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great beach volleyball
customer_reviews.text: Don't get it wet or like most beach volleybalss it get heavier. These are offical beach volleyballs, you probably should buy 4 or more for practice.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Beach Volleyball
customer_reviews.text: My 15 yo plays beach VB. This Ball is a must for all beach VB players. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Best sand volleyball out there!
customer_reviews.text: Durable and will last. This is my second Wilson AVP in 6 years...love them
customer_reviews.author: Tobes!

customer_reviews.title: Great ball for every type of game!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Ball! Much better than the walmart or generic brands... actually last and feels good !
customer_reviews.author: WBH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ball for outdoor sand vball
customer_reviews.text: We have been playing a recreational group vball and this ball is durable and playable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: In Arizona, this is *the* ball
customer_reviews.text: Very different characteristics to the KOB ball. Less bouncy. Little more difficult to float serve. After much use, gains less weight from sweat/moisture.
customer_reviews.author: ARMYfieldmedic

customer_reviews.title: excellent ball
customer_reviews.text: got mine through Wilson. Made in China and it's great
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Brand new, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Brand new in box but it was listed as “Used - Very Good.” Saved a good bit of money and got the same new ball for the discounted price. VERY happy!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: KOTB is better but still a great ball
customer_reviews.text: Great ball. I gave it a 4 because I personally like the KOTB ball better, but thid is still a really good ball
customer_reviews.author: cire

customer_reviews.title: Best for Sand Volleyball
customer_reviews.text: Best sand volleyball there is, I wouldn’t get any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent balls
customer_reviews.text: We use these for beach volleyball games. Best ones I've used so far. Very well made and durable. With daily use we get 3 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Has a good grip
customer_reviews.text: The surface feels soft and it has a good amount of grip
customer_reviews.author: Peach

customer_reviews.title: Better than your average ball!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality ball. Decent price as I have seen them for 75 regularly. I’ve only had it a week or so, but I’m happy with it so far!
customer_reviews.author: casey ten bruin

customer_reviews.title: Ball gets heavy when wet
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered 4 of these balls already and 3 of them are unusable now as they get really really heavy when it gets wet. We played in some rain and afterwards the ball is unusable. This is terrible design for an outdoor ball
customer_reviews.author: Nitin Natarajan

customer_reviews.title: "Excellent Ball" according to a 30 year Vet.
customer_reviews.text: I love this new design. Most balls need a long break in period for that but this ball felt good right out of the Amazon box. It was a little over-inflated when received but a quick poke with the needle and it was ready for play. Others also loved it and were pleasantly surprised at how well it played on day one. I have a really hot serve and hand-set whenever possible and this ball was a perfect fit. Many serious VB players have multiple balls in their arsenal and this should be one of them and maybe, your favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Pat M

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play with it
customer_reviews.text: Just started second season of outdoor volleyball with this ball. It is lasting very well so far. Fun to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: MechEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Athletes Autographed!
customer_reviews.text: Great Volleyball for being autographed by AVP athletes. I purchased this ball prior to going to AVP Championships in Chicago. I used the overnight delivery to assure I received the ball prior to leaving for the trip. The ball came in time and the ball has become a great souvenir.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Spaulding

customer_reviews.title: Great volleyball
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this ball as a replacement for his very, very worn out ball. He really likes it and uses it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dana W. Shreve

customer_reviews.title: good volleyball
customer_reviews.text: I like the new AVP ball much better than the old one. I play beach volleyball tournaments and this is the ball you have to use for my local organizer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Great ball
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, got the Chinese version so I was happy, would have sent it back otherwise after reading other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase, I am so glad I ordered it!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Casarrubias-Tapia

customer_reviews.title: made-in-china version. A+++.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered (3) of these and all of them were the made-in-china version (which is the better ball).
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel G Riek

customer_reviews.title: Volleyball player enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: That's an excelent item the right balance bounces good as well
customer_reviews.author: vicente garcia

customer_reviews.title: A little better than KOB
customer_reviews.text: It's a good volleyball. And Volley America just switched to using it so I had to get it. I actually enjoy hitting and setting it more than the king of the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R.

customer_reviews.title: I received a made-in-China one! Fortunately!
customer_reviews.text: This is a soft ball, good quality, mine is made in China, which is much better than that made in Vietnam ! 🙏🏼 Im really satisfied with that!
customer_reviews.author: MELISSA CUNHA SANTOS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you are playing outdoor sand volleyball then this is the ball you need.
customer_reviews.author: David S. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great ball. All on my league ask to use this ball.
customer_reviews.author: EEnergy

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball
customer_reviews.text: I love the texture of this ball when it's new. Also easy to draw on so you can tell yours apart. Sadly, this isnt the main ball anymore. Great price
customer_reviews.author: Kat

product_meta.title: Wilson OPTX AVP Official Beach Volleyball
feature_bullets: 18 panel, hand sewn expert construction and craftsmanship enables deep groves for better hand control and wind resistance
Premium microfiber composite leather provides greater resistance to dirt and less moisture absorbency to maintain proper weight and feel
New superior graphics for improved ball spin detection and contemporary design
Performance Elastomer Bladder engages a likable responsiveness promoting control and power plays
Overall construction provides strong durability and shape retention giving the player continuous reliability
